solution.title: Our Ecological Solution
solution.subtitle: High-quality briquettes made from local agricultural waste
solution.problem_intro: In Benin, 90% of households use charcoal as their main energy source for cooking. This dependence leads to:
solution.problem_1: Massive deforestation: 70,000 hectares of forests lost each year
solution.problem_2: High costs: charcoal represents 30% of modest households' budgets
solution.problem_4: Resource waste: tons of agricultural waste burned or abandoned
solution.solution_intro: Briqu'Vert transforms agricultural waste (corn stalks, cashew shells, sawdust) into high-quality ecological briquettes.
solution.solution_desc: Our innovative process creates a high-performance fuel that:
solution.feature_1_desc: Made only from local agricultural residues, without chemical additives
solution.feature_2_desc: Calorific value of 4500 kcal/kg, long burning time (3-4 hours)
solution.feature_3_desc: Quick ignition, little smoke, ashes reusable as fertilizer
solution.feature_4_desc: Packaging in 5kg, 10kg and 25kg bags, long shelf life
solution.feature_5_desc: Zero deforestation, waste valorization, carbon neutral
solution.feature_6_desc: Competitive price, reduction of household energy costs
solution.cta_subtitle: Contact us to place an order or learn more about our solution

impact_page.title: Our Environmental and Social Impact
impact_page.subtitle: Every Briqu'Vert briquette contributes to environmental protection and economic development of local communities in Benin.
impact_page.co2_reduction_desc: By replacing charcoal with our ecological briquettes, we significantly reduce CO₂ emissions. Valorizing agricultural residues also avoids methane (CH₄) emissions that would result from their decomposition or open burning.
impact_page.forest_protection_desc: Each ton of briquettes produced preserves hectares of forest that would have been cut to produce charcoal. This directly contributes to fighting deforestation in Benin and preserving biodiversity.
impact_page.jobs_desc: Our economic model creates employment opportunities for local populations, with a particular focus on including women and youth:
impact_page.health_desc: Our briquettes produce less smoke and fine particles than traditional charcoal, improving indoor air quality and reducing respiratory disease risks for Beninese families.
impact_page.case_study_desc: The women's cooperative in Akpakpa adopted our briquettes 6 months ago. The results are impressive and demonstrate the concrete impact of our solution.
